Thanks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29642].
  {panel}

h3. Current situation
The Two-Dimensional Filter Gadget can only use filters that have been saved.

h3. Improvement Request
To be able to enter the URL of the search. For example, enter this URL {code}http://localhost:8082/jira/secure/IssueNavigator!executeAdvanced.jspa?jqlQuery=project+%3D+TestC+and+created+%3E+2012&runQuery=true&clear=true{code} into the Two-Dimensional Filter Gadget. This is so that the filter will not have to be saved and the gadget can still be used.
fields.summary: Ability to use filter URL for JIRA Two-Dimensional Filter Gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29640].
  {panel}

We need to avoid Cross-site Scripting vulnerabilities. A function should be created to provide server side and client side input validation where applicable. Special characters should be stripped out during the validation process.
The following special characters should be stripped out if unnecessary:
[1] | (pipe sign)
[2] & (ampersand sign)
[3] ; (semicolon sign)
[4] $ (dollar sign)
[5] % (percent sign)
[6] @ (at sign)
[7] ' (single apostrophe)
[8] " (quotation mark)
[9] \' (backslash-escaped apostrophe)
[10] \" (backslash-escaped quotation mark)
[11] <> (triangular parenthesis)
[12] () (parenthesis)
[13] + (plus sign)
[14] CR (Carriage return, ASCII 0x0d)
[15] LF (Line feed, ASCII 0x0a)
[16] , (comma sign)
[17] \ (backslash)

During testing, we found following urls to reproduce the Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities.

https://del-test.sapient.resultspace.com/jira/rest/api/1.0/labels/suggest

Vulnerable Parameters: query, suggest

https://del-test.sapient.resultspace.com/jira/rest/gadget/1.0/createdVsResolved/generate

Vulnerable Parameters : projectOrFilterId

https://del-test.sapient.resultspace.com/jira/rest/gadget/1.0/createdVsResolved/validate

Vulnerable Parameters: projectOrFilterId, validate

https://deltest.sapient.resultspace.com/jira/rest/greenhopper/1.0/context-list/generate

Vulnerable Parameters: projectId,generate

https://deltest.sapient.resultspace.com/jira/rest/greenhopper/1.0/versionBoardlist/generate

Vulnerable Parameters: projectId, generate

Please find the attachment Cross_Site_Scripting.txt file for details in response.
fields.summary: The JIRA/Crowd applications fail to properly sanitize user input in the query string of the website or in the value of a parameter
Addition Event: MODULE_REFRESHED
As a website visitor, I would like to submit a screenshot when sending in a issue report/feedback form
Attach File dialog static message: "No file chosen"
As JIRA Administrator I would like to have audit logs for version changes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29625].
  {panel}

We want to control the server's caching directives from within individual scripts. We have identified following locations, where we can provide HTTP headers 'Cache-control: no-store' and 'Pragma: no-cache'. Please provide these response headers to the following identified locations and to all other pages where the sensitive contents must not be cached on the client.

/jira/includes/blank.html
/jira/plugins/servlet/gadgets/dashboard-diagnostics
/jira/plugins/servlet/gadgets/ifr
/jira/plugins/servlet/gliffyapi/clientresource
/jira/rest/plugins/1.0/notifications/kbiswas
/jira/s/en_US-jqmja3/729/168/_/favicon.ico
fields.summary: The application should return caching directives instructing browsers not to store local copies of any sensitive data.
Customfield type is now an ArrayList for group picker type
Ability to set default value for contents of standard fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29614].
  {panel}

h3. Current situation
Currently, JIRA is set so that even after a custom field is added into the navigator columns in the Administrator page, it might not appear in the search columns (of the issue Navigator). This happens if the project is set to a specific context (a certain project or issue type). If the specific project or issue type is not chosen as the search criteria, it will not appear in the search columns. 

For example, the user have 3 projects, Project A, Project B, Project C, and one custom field, Custom X. Custom X is set to only show in Project A. User then adds Custom X to the Navigator Columns. The user then tries searching in a global context, selecting all projects. Custom X does not appear in the search columns. However, if the user specifies the search to only search in Project A, Custom X will appear in the search columns.

h3. Improvement Request
It would be useful if the custom fields would appear in the search columns regardless of the context of the custom field. So, users won't have to specify the exact project or issues and the custom fields would still appear, as long as they have been added into the Navigator Columns
fields.summary: Allow custom fields to appear in search columns regardless of context
Leaving a comment in the add attachment, link, ... dialog should have a reference to the attachment, link, in the comment on the issue screen
Add a shortcut key to add a private comment...
Jira log-in process takes 2 steps and the first "you must log-in" screen is uneeded

We have to provide the following HTTP headers in all responses containing sensitive content:
Cache-control: no-store
Pragma: no-cache

We have identified some files at the following path, where we need to provide above headers. We are not able to identify the jsp pages or servlet, so that we can provide these headers. Can you please suggest us the exact locations of the pages? If they are servlets, these headers should be provided there.

/jira/plugins/servlet/gadgets/dashboard-diagnostics
/jira/plugins/servlet/gadgets/ifr
/jira/plugins/servlet/gliffyapi/clientresource

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

Please bundle JIRA Admin Helper with JIRA - this will help to cut down support load significantly.

Link to plugin:

* https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-admin-helper-plugin

If JIRA is out of the question we'd like to see it bundled with OnDemand. :)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29591].
  {panel}

This issue affects all versions of JIRA up to the present day. To reproduce

i) type a search term into "Quick Search"
ii) press the back button
iii) press the forward button

Some variety of confusing dialogs ensue, but the user does not return to their search. All searches have the URL, for example https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa rather than a URL which is related to the search, of the style that has been popular pretty much since search engines have been invented (e.g. Google). 

In the recent versions of JIRA, we now get the EXTRA dialog from JIRA itself "Unsaved changes - confirm that you want to navigate away" - in addition to the dialogs from the browser "Confirm form resubmission". This is an awkward user experience that interrupts this very common workflow. Please could you supply proper URLs at least for the case of simple searches as has been common in commercial search engines for a long time - it is understandable if complex JQL searches are not bookmarkable and degrade, but it should be possible to supply URL support for a variety of straightforward searches.

Many thanks
fields.summary: Back button does not work correctly in searches (confirm form resubmission dialog)
All on screen failures should include a timestamp

fields.description:
We migrated our old Jira 4.3 to the latest Jira using the xml import.
The xml import migrated all previously configured dashboards as well. 
So far so good.

But where seems to be a problem with certain (old) gadgets which now display following error:
{code}
Error loading gadget from rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:workloadpie-gadget/com/atlassian/jira/ext/charting/gadget/workloadpie-gadget.xml: org.apache.shindig.gadgets.GadgetException: Unable to retrieve gadget xml. HTTP error 404
{code}


Right now I can't delete these Gadgets from the Dashboard and not even the entire Dashboard on which these old gadgets where defined.

UPDATE:
Installing the Charting widget resolves the error, but it should be possible to delete said gadgets without them...?
fields.summary: Can't delete Widget with org.apache.shindig.gadgets.GadgetException after XML Import

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29582].
  {panel}

h3. Symptom

Attempting to startup JIRA presents the following error:

{noformat}
****************************************************************************************************
Failed to start JIRA due to a build number inconsistency.
The data present in your database is newer than the version of JIRA you are trying to startup.
Database version is: 6096
JIRA app version is: 733
Please use the correct version of JIRA. You are running: 5.0.6#733-sha1:f48fab7a0abaa0a316c14a3fc86cdf5a6805ba12
****************************************************************************************************
{noformat}

(i) The build numbers will vary dependent upon the version of JIRA being used.

h3. Cause

A test/dev/sandbox instance was started up against the same database production is using. This will trigger upgrade tasks to run and will alter the database so that it is setup for the new version. As the check is not performed at runtime, the production instance will not know this has happened until a restart is attempted, at which point the check is executed and the startup will fail.

h3. Workaround

This can be fixed with either of the two options, *after the test/dev/sandbox instance has been pointed to the correct test database*.

# Perform  an emergency upgrade on the production instance to the same version as test as per [Upgrading JIRA|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA].
# Restore an XML backup or database backup from *prior* to the upgrade by the test/dev/sandbox server. One can be found on the test/dev/sandbox instance under {{$JIRA_HOME/export/jira_autoexport_20130530_102302.zip}} (the naming convention will vary as it depends upon the date).

Please note that if the first option is selected the integrity of the database cannot be guaranteed, as JIRA was never designed to have multiple instances utilising the same database. This can cause critical data integrity issues that may be irreparable. 

h3. Resolution

We have seen users frequently connect their test/dev/sandbox instances to the production database accidentally.

The use case is an admin copies their {{$JIRA_HOME}} for testing, but the {{dbconfig.xml}} file is still pointing to their production database. If the {{dbconfig.xml}} file is forgotten to be altered to point at a testing database, when that server starts up it this will then fire off upgrade tasks at the production database from the testing installation if it is on a newer version.

I would like to request a database lock (maybe a table entry to the {{$JIRA_HOME}} lock file, and its pairing {{$JIRA_INSTALL}} directory, or some other method of uniquely identifying an instance) during bootup or some sort of other workaround to avoid the situation of two JIRA installs pointing at one database as this is a common occurrence.
fields.summary: Preventing the "The data present in your database is newer than the version of JIRA you are trying to startup." using a Database Lock

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29581].
  {panel}

Currently we get a lot of support cases due to plugins and anecdotally I have seen a lot of them relating specifically to upgrades. Often when a customer upgrades they will leave their old plugins in {{$JIRA_HOME/plugins/installed-plugins}} and this can cause a number of problems during that upgrade process. We have even had one of our experts even get confused about this in the docs and raise a support case about it.

Specifically, there's some differences between docs as outlined below and it can be a bit confusing.

Both [Upgrading JIRA|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA] and [Migrating JIRA to Another Server|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Migrating+JIRA+to+Another+Server] have the following in the Before You Start section:

{quote}
If you have installed any additional JIRA plugins (i.e. not included with JIRA), please verify that they will be compatible with the version of JIRA you are upgrading to. You can find a plugin's compatibility information from the the plugin's home page on the [Atlassian Plugin Exchange|https://marketplace.atlassian.com]. Once you have confirmed the availability of compatible versions, you should upgrade your plugins after successfully upgrading JIRA. This can be done via the *'Plugin Repository'* in your *Administration Console*.
{quote}

And then [Upgrading JIRA Manually|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA+Manually] has the following in section 3.2:

{quote}
* *Plugins*— For any plugins that you had installed in your old JIRA:
*# Download the plugin version for your new version of JIRA from the [http://plugins.atlassian.com] site.
*# [Install the JAR file(s)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+JIRA%27s+Plugins] in your new JIRA, and carry out any other required installation for the plugin.
*# If the plugin has a properties file, apply the same changes to it as you had in the old properties file (don't just copy over the old properties file).
{quote}

And [Migrating JIRA to Another Server|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Migrating+JIRA+to+Another+Server] has the following in section 3.2:

{quote}
* *Plugins* — For any plugins that you had installed in your old JIRA, download the plugin version for your new version of JIRA from the [http://plugins.atlassian.com] site.
{quote}

----

The main problem here is that if the customer follows the first piece of the docs, they can proceed with an upgrade that can cause problems on their JIRA instance. For example, if they try to upgrade and restore an XML backup that requires a custom field from a plugin, and that plugin isn't enabled because the plugin was disabled due to being incompatible the upgrade process can fail.

If they follow the [Upgrading JIRA Manually|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA+Manually] part in 3.2, this is the best suggestion as it will get them to upgrade their plugins manually on the new install by putting the new JARs into {{$JIRA_HOME/plugins/installed-plugins}} before starting up JIRA, and they can avoid incompatibility problems (unless they install the wrong version).

It doesn't clearly list to do it that way, and I'm wondering if you can modify both [Upgrading JIRA Manually|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA+Manually] and [Migrating JIRA to Another Server|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Migrating+JIRA+to+Another+Server] so it would have something like the following, maybe even in its own section:

{quote}
h3. Plugins

Prior to starting JIRA up, it is important to ensure the new version has the correct plugins installed. Any incompatibilities can cause significant problems during the upgrade - to avoid this, please follow the below instructions to upgrade your plugins manually:

# Manually move all your plugins from {{$JIRA_HOME/plugins/installed-plugins}} to a temporary directory.
# Check the [Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com] for the most recent version of the plugin that is compatible with the new JIRA version.
# Download that plugin JAR and install it into the {{$JIRA_HOME/plugins/installed-plugins}} directory.
# Repeat steps 2-3 for each of your plugins.
# After installing all the new versions of the plugins, start the new version of JIRA up.
{quote}

Perhaps this isn't the ideal way of doing it, however it should help provide more information to customers on the impact their plugins can have on upgrading, and also get them to manually upgrade the plugins before upgrading so as to reduce the number of support issues we get.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Upgrading JIRA Documentation: Plugins

fields.description:
When i send an email from a windows machine to generate tickets, the subject line is not decoded correctly. We get Tickets with subjects like "=?us-ascii?Q?Account disabled?=" or "=?utf-8?Q?Account disabled?=".

Mail-Client such as Outlook display the correct subject line "Account disabled".

Is this a known behaviour or are there plans to change it?
fields.summary: MailFetcherService does not decode E-Mail subject properly

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29550].
  {panel}

At the moment, the Excel export is accessible by all users. Since there is possibility that user has triggered this feature very frequently, this might cause slowness in the instance. 

Therefore, it will be nice to have if:
* there permission exist to restrict this feature to certain groups
* there is an option to disable this feature
* there any limit of total number of Excel export can be generated per minute
fields.summary: Ability To Restrict or Limit or Disabling the Excel Export

fields.description:
Let's say I have a user with username "johndoe" and display name "John Doe". 

When entering a comment, typing @john will suggest (correctly) "John Doe - john@doe.com (johndoe)". Selecting that user from the suggest, it will insert "[~johndoe] into my comment. All good so far. 

When I add the comment, plain-text of "[~johndoe]" is contained in the comment, and not a hyperlink/reference to the John Doe user. 

(I manage two JIRA instances, one of them behaves how I'd expect and hyperlinks "John Doe" to the user.. But this instance in question doesn't behave this way)
fields.summary: User mentions don't expand to show full display names

any user that make change in issue make the user a watcher of this issue.

before, this problem didn't exist. I need to change this and that a user is watcher only if requested.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29542].
  {panel}

Hi there

We have a script schedule to run every night at 00:02 AM to rebuild the subversion integration indexes. In the process it shutdown the Jira first, delete and rebuild the indexes and finally startup the Jira.

However at the stage when it finally try to start Jira, it faile dto start smoothly. The error which comes in the catalina.out file shows the jira home directory is locked as below.


The jira.home directory '/data/jiraprod' is already locked. Please see http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/docs-042/How+do+I+unlock+my+JIRA+home+directory%3F?clic
ked=jirahelp# for more information on locked jira.home directories.


******************************************
JIRA startup failed, JIRA has been locked.
******************************************

Then jira failed to start. In most of the ocassions when I checked the Jira home directory, I don't find out any jira-home.lock. So finally the solution is to manually restart the jira.

Its happening nowadays quite frequently. Could you please guide me if you have any solution to avoid the locking of Jira directory.

Thanks
Ashish
fields.summary: Script Fails to start Jira
Created and Updated fields do not show timestamp
JIRA System Administrator permissions(eg. save filter)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29537].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

It would be useful if the user could view multiple workflows graphically, so that the workflows can be compared. Some users have a lot of workflows, so it can be quite troublesome if the user has to view each workflow individually.

It would be even better if the user could compare workflows step by step like this :

{noformat}
Workflow A      Workflow B
Step A1         Step B1
Step A2         Step B2
...             ...
...             ...
...             ...
{noformat}
fields.summary: View or compare workflows graphically
Add support for Chrome Frame in IE

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29530].
  {panel}

Admins are able to delete active workflow schemes, which would cause the associated workflows to appear inactive, opening the possibility to having an active workflow being deleted, resulting in issues that have no transitions or transitions that are incorrect. You will probably see in the logs:

* Some warnings like:
{noformat}
2012-08-29 14:30:08,476 http-bio-8090-exec-10 ERROR admin 869x18070x1 k49von 172.20.9.76 /browse/MKY-2 [atlassian.jira.workflow.IssueWorkflowManagerImpl] State of issue [MKY-2] has an action [id=11] which cannot be found in the workflow descriptor
2012-08-29 14:30:08,476 http-bio-8090-exec-10 ERROR admin 869x18070x1 k49von 172.20.9.76 /browse/MKY-2 [atlassian.jira.workflow.IssueWorkflowManagerImpl] State of issue [MKY-2] has an action [id=21] which cannot be found in the workflow descriptor
2012-08-29 14:30:08,476 http-bio-8090-exec-10 ERROR admin 869x18070x1 k49von 172.20.9.76 /browse/MKY-2 [atlassian.jira.workflow.IssueWorkflowManagerImpl] State of issue [MKY-2] has an action [id=41] which cannot be found in the workflow descriptor
2012-08-29 14:33:03,579 http-bio-8090-exec-17 ERROR admin 870x18295x1 k49von 172.20.9.76 /browse/MKY-2 [atlassian.jira.workflow.IssueWorkflowManagerImpl] State of issue [MKY-2] has an action [id=11] which cannot be found in the workflow descriptor
2012-08-29 14:33:05,850 http-bio-8090-exec-17 ERROR admin 870x18295x1 k49von 172.20.9.76 /browse/MKY-2 [atlassian.jira.workflow.IssueWorkflowManagerImpl] State of issue [MKY-2] has an action [id=21] which cannot be found in the workflow descriptor
2012-08-29 14:33:08,013 http-bio-8090-exec-17 ERROR admin 870x18295x1 k49von 172.20.9.76 /browse/MKY-2 [atlassian.jira.workflow.IssueWorkflowManagerImpl] State of issue [MKY-2] has an action [id=41] which cannot be found in the workflow descriptor
{noformat}
* Exceptions like:
{noformat}
2012-08-29 14:44:07,202 http-bio-8090-exec-15 ERROR admin 883x463x1 x4ixsb 172.20.9.76 /browse/MKY-2 [opensymphony.workflow.basic.BasicWorkflow] Error checking available actions
com.opensymphony.workflow.FactoryException: Unknown workflow name
        at com.opensymphony.workflow.config.DefaultConfiguration.getWorkflow(DefaultConfiguration.java:92)
        at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.getAvailableActions(AbstractWorkflow.java:77)
        at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.IssueWorkflowManagerImpl.getAvailableActionIds(IssueWorkflowManagerImpl.java:140)
        at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.IssueWorkflowManagerImpl.getAvailableActions(IssueWorkflowManagerImpl.java:41)
        at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.IssueWorkflowManagerImpl.getSortedAvailableActions(IssueWorkflowManagerImpl.java:65)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.transitions.TransitionLinkFactory.getAvailableActions(TransitionLinkFactory.java:63)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.transitions.TransitionLinkFactory.getLinks(TransitionLinkFactory.java:52)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.webfragment.DefaultSimpleLinkManager.getLinks(DefaultSimpleLinkManager.java:190)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.webfragment.DefaultSimpleLinkManager.getLinksForSection(DefaultSimpleLinkManager.java:124)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.util.IssueOperationsBarUtil.getLinksForSection(IssueOperationsBarUtil.java:208)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.util.IssueOperationsBarUtil.getPromotedLinks(IssueOperationsBarUtil.java:105)  <+3> (NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39) (DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
        at webwork.util.InjectionUtils$DefaultInjectionImpl.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:70)
        at webwork.util.InjectionUtils.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:56)
        at webwork.util.ValueStack.findValue(ValueStack.java:514)
        at webwork.util.ValueStack.findValue(ValueStack.java:213)
        at webwork.view.taglib.WebWorkBodyTagSupport.findValue(WebWorkBodyTagSupport.java:62)
        at webwork.view.taglib.BasicPropertyTag.doStartTag(BasicPropertyTag.java:54)
        at org.apache.jsp.includes.panels.issue.viewissue_002dopsbar_jsp._jspx_meth_ww_005fproperty_005f6(viewissue_002dopsbar_jsp.java:535)
{noformat}

You should be able to fix this by migrating that project onto a new workflow scheme. You cannot use the default workflow scheme.
fields.summary: Admins are able to delete active workflow schemes, potentially resulting in data corruption

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29528].
  {panel}

h3. Replication Steps

# Install [chrome frame|http://www.google.com/chromeframe/eula.html] into IE8.
# Browse to *Administration > Project > People*.

h3. Current Behaviour

As in the attached screenshot, the page does not render and only displays {{wait.gif}}.

h3. Expected Behaviour

The page loads successfully.

h3. Workarounds

* Disable the Chrome Frame plugin.
* Use another browser, such as Chrome or Firefox.

(!) Whilst this is not supported, as in our [Supported Platforms|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms], this case has been raised as the Chrome Frame is an excellent workaround for organisations who have to use IE.
fields.summary: When using Chrome Frame in IE8, Project > People does not load
Lost data if you try to save a edited field with a lost connection
Add support for transitioning issues with the IssueService with optional notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29524].
  {panel}

API's are needed to fetch the information from JIRA. Such as,

1. Fetch the Custom field information such as id, name, value.
2. Fetch the issue history such as status changes, fix versions.

Basically, its good if we can have API's for all the JIRA data that we could fetch through database.

fields.description:
After creating the issue, when we mark our self as watcher and after some time we want to stop watching the issue, we are getting attached error.

Steps:-

2. More-action > watch issue.
3. More-action > stop watching.
4. error.

Regards,
Dhanesh.
fields.summary: Stopwatching throws the error

Make DefaultLicenseCountService use the LicenseManager to retrieve OnDemand license information

atlassian sites status page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29503].
  {panel}

When users share filters or Dashboards with 'Everyone' the following message is displayed:
"Sharing with everyone will make this visible to users who are not logged in."

But this leads them to believe that only jira-users not logged will be able to view and not every person that manages to find the 'Manage Filters' or 'Manage Dashboards' link.

Also, on the 'Manage Filters' or 'Manage Dashboards' screen they are displayed as 'Shared with all users' which strengthens the belief that it is only shared with internal users.

It would be better to change this labels to 'Share with world' to enforce that everyone will have access to the filters.
fields.summary: Wording for sharing Filters and Dashboards with Everyone is misleading
Created vs resolved gadget improvement
Need a way to apply a validator to ensure two Issue fields do not match

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29499].
  {panel}

The _Administer Project_ permission's description is _Ability to administer a project in JIRA._
!perm.png!

Could we enrich it a bit based on what the Project Administrator can and cannot do (e.g. _Administer Project - Please note that some actions in Workflows and Issue Types require a Global Administrator Permission_)

That could prevent some misunderstandings.
fields.summary: "Administer Projects" permission could be enriched with a more appropriate description

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29498].
  {panel}

As a Jira administrator, I would like to select one of multiple renderers in field configurations at least for version system fields (and version custom fields). This would allow to use Fix versions in Greenhopper even if it is slightly customized, e.g.:
* to support single selection
* to extend the version number by additional information like 
** a build number when showing it on view screens
** version numbers from incomming and/or outgoing links (see attached image) 

Both Atlassian and customer should be able to provide renderer.

With the current approach, where renderer are not pluggable, customers have to use custom fields in many situations, which means Greenhopper cannot fully work.
fields.summary: Pluggable renderer at least for fix version system field needed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29493].
  {panel}

As per REST documentation in http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#id123696

there is no API to update a project details, mainly the 'description', 'url' and 'name'. 

Those fields can be editing in a SOAP call, but as SOAP is being deprecated in favor of REST, it would be good to get this PUT call implemented. 

(I've also checked http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/5.2-m03/ and it doesn't seem to be there as well).

Equivalent SOAP call:
http://docs.atlassian.com/rpc-jira-plugin/4.4/com/atlassian/jira/rpc/soap/JiraSoapService.html#updateProject(java.lang.String, com.atlassian.jira.rpc.soap.beans.RemoteProject)

Thanks,
Johan.
fields.summary: Add Project update to REST API
Closing issues should set the work remaining to 0
Upgrade JIRA-FishEye plugin to 5.2.2

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29487].
  {panel}

We have this hardcoded in the scheduler configuration to run at midnight every day:

{code}
<trigger name="OptimizeIndexesTrigger" job="OptimizeIndexes" type="cron">
    <expression>0 0 0 * * ?</expression><!-- run at midnight -->
</trigger>
{code}

h3. TL;DR

That needs to go away.

h3. Detailed explanation for the curious

During normal operation, Lucene deletes documents by simply marking them as such but leaving them in the segment.  This is a performance trade-off because it makes the write much faster, but wastes disk space and would eventually slow down searches that have to skip over the deleted documents.

In older versions of Lucene, such as those used prior to JIRA 5.0, this is dealt with by explicitly optimizing the index, which rebuilds all of the segments without the deleted documents in them.  To make sure the indexes stay in reasonably good shape, we added the scheduled job shown above.

In JIRA 5.0, we adopted Lucene 3.2 and its new TieredMergePolicy that tries to distribute this work more reasonably over time by noticing when deleting a document puts the segment over some threshold (say 10% deleted documents) and optimizing that single segment immediately.  Since this happens automatically, there is much less reason to explicitly request a global optimization of the entire index, which for large customers in particular can be a very expensive operation and lead to request timeouts as write operations stall waiting up to 30 seconds for the index optimization to get out of the way if people happen to be doing work at midnight server time.

In some cases, we have even seen this lead to inconsistent state between the database and the Lucene indexes as the write requests for the index get dropped.  This was allegedly fixed in [JRA-14220|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-14220], but a recent support case indicates that it may not adequately address the problem.

In short, the optimize operation should be superfluous at this point, and the long delays it causes may be creating additional problems, so it should just go away.
fields.summary: Remove hardcoded OptimizeIndexTrigger from scheduler config

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29485].
  {panel}

When I go here:
https://jira.atlassian.com/plugins/servlet/project-config/RNDR

and click on "Configure permission and default field values" at the bottom of the page (from remote issue copy plugin), it instead takes me to a screen for entering the API token for HipChat! 

!NaughtyHipChatPlugin_01_GotThis.png!

I then re-abled the HipChat plugin and the "Configure permission and default field values" works as expected, however, the hipchat conifguration action now takes me to the config page for "Configure permission and default field values"

!hip_chat_remote.png!

Marking critical because it isn't clear how consistent this is, and it could get in the way of something very important. It looks like a problem with JIRA rather than the plugins themselves.
fields.summary: Hipchat plugin is intercepting admin links for other modules
Support for Evernote Links
Shared items dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29482].
  {panel}

If you have a multiselect custom field in one of the Issue Navigator columns, the order of the selected items is not properly showed.

In example, let's say that you have a multiselect field with 4 values (A, B, C and D). 
In one issue you selected the A and B option.
In the second issue, you selected the A, B and C option.

The column related to this custom field will show for the first issue this order: B, A.
And for the second issue, will show this: C, B, A.

It always shows the order from bottom to top, doesn't matter the order that you selected the options.

It will make more sense if this column show an alphabetical order of the selected values.
fields.summary: Change the default order of a Multiselect Custom Field column in the Issue Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29479].
  {panel}

As a software release engineer, I often need to search for our next release.  I am able to do so using: fixVersion = earliestUnreleasedVersion("PROJECT")

However, I also need to view tickets in the release after that (and after that).  It would be nice to be able to have a dashboard for this without having to modify filters.

Proposed solution: Implement math-based operators for fixVersion
Next release: fixVersion = earliestUnreleasedVersion("PROJECT")
Release after that: fixVersion = earliestUnreleasedVersion("PROJECT")+1
                    OR
                    fixVersion = earliestUnreleasedVersion("PROJECT", +1)
fields.summary: Add math-based operator functionality to fixVersion
Please move app links data into AO tables

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29474].
  {panel}

Hi guys,

Welcome to the JIRA 5.2 Early Access Program (EAP)!

Thanks for trying out our early look at our next release. You can download the latest EAP release (milestone build, beta or release candidate) [here|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/download-eap].

We really appreciate you taking the time to provide us any feedback on the contents of the EAP.

Simply comment below for any comments you may have.

Cheers,

Bryan, Roy, Mairead, and Josh

JIRA Product Management
fields.summary: EAP Feedback - JIRA 5.2
Include the project key changes in JIRA 5.0 release notes
Additional Step to be Added for Manual Upgrade Procedure
Include the 'Created' timestamp for a vote in the JIRA REST API
Option to Set Assignee to Project's Default Assignee when Moving Issues Between Projects

Then, an empty transition box appears where the cloned transition should be, and if to click on it, the editor goes into infinite update state, which can only be interrupted by refreshing the whole page.
fields.summary: Flash workflow editor crashes if a cloned transition has the same name as the original one
Danger! Danger!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29460].
  {panel}

My apologies if this is fixed in 5.1 (I'll upgrade soon)....

In JIRA 5.0.5 and according the documentation, JIRA will not return a full JSON response when creating a issueLink  between 2 issues:
http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#id120764
(POST /rest/api/2/issueLink).

Ideally, it would be nice to receive at least the link ID to store locally in case we need to re-use it (delete it) shortly after. That would save time instead of re-querying the JIRA issue(s) since I have all other link information except the ID after the post.

Cheers,
Johan.
fields.summary: Return JSON object with linkID on issueLink creation
Support Postgres 9.1

fields.description: Whenever we export to Excel via Issue Navigator, the resulting document is not seen as a valid Excel file (see attached image).  If I click 'Yes', it seems to open fine in Excel 2007.  Other colleagues are getting blank files.
fields.summary: Excel Export from Issue Navigator produces corrupt Excel files

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29452].
  {panel}

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching#AdvancedSearching-Component

I have 2 projects, one with components and one with no components. If I write a query such as 

project in (HASCOMP, NOCOMP)

then I get all the issues I expect. If I write

project in (HASCOMP, NOCOMP) and component in ("Component A")

I only get issues from the HASCOMP project. The missing information is that you have to explicitly check for empty components to get the expected results. This can be done with:

project in (HASCOMP, NOCOMP) and (component in ("Component A") or component is EMPTY)

or with the undocumented value "Empty", as in:

project in (HASCOMP, NOCOMP) and component in ("Component A", Empty)
fields.summary: Document that Empty is a valid value for Component

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29450].
  {panel}

In the default workflow, the screens have help notes.
For example the resolve issue dialog:
!resolve issue.PNG!

It would be really nice, if it is possible to add an note to an custom screen...for informing the user about important things for using this screen.

It should be possible to define the type "error, info, .." and the message....or define the box with html. 
Maybe it could be done with transition properties....one for the type and one for the message.
fields.summary: Add notes to screens
Permissions on which fields can be edited depending on the status of the issue
Support IE 10

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29447].
  {panel}

In some organisations, as part of a set of security requirements, it is required for compliant applications, to disallow users to store there application password in their browser.

It would be perfect, if JIRA (and all other Atlassian applications) would allow to configure the autocomplete="off" attribute for username and password fields as well as turning of the "Remember me on this computer" function.

Here is how it might get implemented:
Add an boolean option called "Allow users to store there login and keeping logged in" in the Administration section under "General Configuration".
If set to On, JIRA should behave as today (default).
If set to Off, the login gadget as well as the dedicated login pages (including the Administrator login) should include the autocomplete="off" attribute for username and password fields. Additionally, the login gadget as well as the dedicated login page should not display the "Remember me on this computer" function.
fields.summary: As a JIRA System Administrator, I can instruct web browsers to not allow saving a user's password in the various login options, so that unauthorized users can not access the system.
jira service command does not support restart command

fields.description:
The 'getRemainingEstimateMinutes', 'getTimeSpentMinutes' and 'getOriginalEstimateMinutes' methods of the TimeTracking class do not return the expected values.

For instance, I have an issue with 67 hours logged, but the getTimeSpentMinutes is returning 45 hours. Note that if I sum up the minutes spent in the worklog class, I get 48 minutes, which is different again.
fields.summary: Time tracking values reported through the API are not correct
